abstract: Democrats and Republicans on the Senate and House intelligence committees denounce leaks to the news media about classified programs, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain is set to testify in a judicial inquiry investigating press ethics, and the fashion designer Nolan Miller dies at age 79.
snippet: Democrats and Republicans on the Senate and House intelligence committees denounce leaks to the news media about classified programs, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain is set to testify in a judicial inquiry investigating press ethics, and t...
lead_paragraph: At a news conference on Capitol Hill on Thursday, Democrats and Republicans on the Senate and House intelligence committees denounced what one called “a cascade of leaks” to the news media about classified programs like drones and cyberwarfare, Scott Shane reported. Two Republican senators, Saxby Chambliss of Georgia and John McCain of Arizona, called this week for the appointment of a special counsel to investigate leaks.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Outrage Over Leaks, and ‘Power’ Designer for ‘Dynasty’
